title: Initialize Account
does: Creates and seeds a custom account with initial data and authority.
why: Demonstrates how programs initialize stateful accounts with ownership and data.
breaksIfRemoved: No account state exists, so later updates have nothing to modify.
securityImplications: Incorrect authority assignment enables unauthorized updates.

title: Update Account
does: Validates the authority and updates stored data.
why: Shows how programs enforce ownership before mutating state.
breaksIfRemoved: State can never change after initialization.
securityImplications: The authority check prevents arbitrary mutation by attackers.
